topic.title: Enabling Compression
topic.abstract: You can configure Greenplum Database to use data compression with some database features. Compression can also be configured with some utilities. Greenplum Database supports gzip, zstd (Zstandard), QuickLZ, and RLE compression.

body.p:
Compression reduces disk usage and improves I/O across the system, however, it adds some overhead when compressing and decompressing data. You can configure Greenplum Database to use data compression for these features and utilities.
Append-optimized tables support compressing table data with zstd, zlib, QuickLZ, or RLE compression. See .
User-defined types can be defined to use zstd, zlib, QuickLZ, or RLE compression. See .
The external table protocols gpfdist (gpfdists), s3, and pxf support gzip compression when accessing external data. For information about external tables, see .
Workfiles, (temporary spill files that are created when executing a query that requires more memory than it is allocated) can compress workfiles with zstd compression. See the server configuration parameter .
The Greenplum Database utilities , , , and support gzip compression.
